intro: Steetzia pannosa, commonly known as the smoothleaf steetzia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are smooth to the touch. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, giving it a delicate appearance. Steetzia pannosa is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
